New Records: Netherlands won their second World Cup game, their first time winning multiple World Cup games
Key Match Events: Bangladesh collapsed to 142/10 in 42.2 overs, losing by 87 runs
Taskin Ahmed was dismissed for 11 runs
Colin Ackermann celebrated the run out of Mahedi Hasan
Bas de Leede got Mahmudullah, Bangladesh's last hope, pulling to midwicket
Mahedi Hasan was run out by Bas de Leede's direct hit
Paul van Meekeren finished the game and took his fourth wicket, finishing with 4 for 23
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands were confident at the halfway mark and thought they had a chance with 230-240
Bangladesh were expected to feel at home at the Eden Gardens but lost the game by 87 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh's collapse was a disappointing end to the game
Netherlands' win was a massive effort and a great comeback after losing to Australia by 309 runs
Bangladesh's chances of making the semis are slim, while Netherlands have relatively better chances
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch bowlers used the extra bounce of the Eden Gardens to their advantage
The spinners extracted more turn than usual, making it difficult for Bangladesh to score
Netherlands' win was powered by their fast bowlers and spinners
Bangladesh's dot-ball trouble in the first powerplay was a concern for the team
Others: The game was played at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata, a classic World Cup venue
The crowd was a mix of Bangladesh and neutral fans, with a splatter of orange in support of the Netherlands
The game was a reminder of the Netherlands' potential and their ability to compete with top teams
